item.title: Hitastig og vindar √≠ √°ratug
item.description: üåÖ J√¶ja, fer hann ekki a√∞ sn√∫ast √≠ nor√∞austan? Vindar√≥sir √Å veturna eru r√≠kjandi √°ttir √° Skagastr√∂nd su√∞-austl√¶gar og nor√∞-austl√¶gar en nor√∞an√°ttirnar eru hvassari en sunnan√°ttirnar √æ√≥ √æ√¶r s√©u √°l√≠ka t√≠√∞ar √≠ m√¶lingum. √Å vindar√≥sunum m√° sj√° t√≠√∞ni vinda eftir √°ttum og vindhra√∞a og h√©r m√° sj√° vindar√≥sir fyrir hvern m√°nu√∞. H√¶gt er a√∞ n√°lgast vindar√≥sir √° vef Ve√∞urstofunnar en √æar sem ve√∞urfar er au√∞vita√∞ mj√∂g breytilegt eftir √°rst√≠√∞um er skemmtilegt a√∞ geta s√©√∞ √æ√¶r fyrir hvern m√°nu√∞.

item.title: Stundaskr√° √≠ R
item.description: Segjum a√∞ einhver s√© a√∞ kenna √° trommur √≠ T√≥nlistarsk√≥la A-H√∫n og vilji gera stundat√∂flu. Stundataflan skarast √° vi√∞ kennslu √≠ grunnsk√≥lanum og √æarf √æv√≠ a√∞ vera breytileg svo krakkarnir missi ekki alltaf af s√∂mu sk√≥lastundunum. √ûa√∞ er leyst me√∞ √æv√≠ a√∞ hli√∞ra nemendum til um einn t√≠ma n√¶sta kennsludag og koll af kolli. H√©r eru R-pakkarnir: Rpakkar <- c("tidyverse","lubridate","DT") pacman::p_load(Rpakkar, character.only = TRUE) Sys.

item.title: Kort af hafstraumum
item.description: H√©r er hlekkur √° Github √æar sem m√° s√¶kja √∂ll skj√∂lin sem √æarf til a√∞ endurgera myndina √° botni √æessar s√≠√∞u. Korti√∞ √° mynd 1 h√©r a√∞ ne√∞an er birt √≠ grein haffr√¶√∞ingsins Kai Logemann. Kai starfa√∞i um √°rabil h√©rlendis og ger√∞i sj√°varfallal√≠kan sem hefur n√Ωst til √æess a√∞ sp√° fyrir um rek agna √≠ sj√≥ kringum landi√∞. √ûetta kort er n√°kv√¶masta straumakort af hafinu kringum √çsland sem √©g veit um og √æess vegna langa√∞i mig til √æess a√∞ endurgera √æa√∞ og um lei√∞ gera g√∂gnin sem √æa√∞ byggir √° a√∞gengilegri.

item.title: Flokkun, flokkunarkerfi Linnaeusar - sj√°lkrafa listi yfir h√¶rri flokkunarstig ger√∞ur √≠ R
item.description: Segjum a√∞ einhvern langi til a√∞ sko√∞a burstaorma √∫r mj√∫kum botni √≠ f√¶reyskum fir√∞i og rekist √æar √° orm sem er bygg√∞ur eins og bambussproti. Vi√∞komandi hringir √≠ vin sem segir a√∞ √æetta s√© pott√æ√©tt Maldanidae-ormur en til √æess a√∞ vita hva√∞a tegund √æetta s√© √æ√° √æurfi a√∞ sko√∞a haus e√∞a afturenda betur. H√∂skuldarvi√∞v√∂run √æetta er ormurinn Praxilella praetermissa sem s√©st h√©r a√∞ ne√∞an.

item.title: The Weather
item.description: After moving to Skagastr√∂nd I became a weather enthusiast. The weather here has such clear patterns that I hadn‚Äôt realized before. In winter a north-east wind brings snow from the highlands that piles up behind every obsticle downwind, so houses that have front doors not facing the blizzard are covered with snow. Figure 1: Regular north western blizzard Not a single snowflake comes from the clouds above, it‚Äôs all carried by wind from the highlands above town, and it‚Äôs densely packed snow powder.

item.title: Sources of Microplastics in Iceland
item.description: The ministry of environment requested an estimate of microplastic pollution to Icelandic seas. The main goal was to obtain information about the main sources and pathways to be able to react with political action if necessary. A part of the goal was to write a overview on the state of knowledge about microplastics regarding the marine environment especially. The outcome was a report (in Icelandic).

item.title: Kelp
item.description: In summertime we marine biologist get to venture out in the sun. Despite regular winds most of the year, summers here are great. But at these high latitudes they are short, only about 3 months. Unfortunately for me, I can get sea sick but still I manage to work my way around it. Figure 1: Click the slideshow above, press 'c' to clone it (opens on a seperate window) and then press 'f' for fullscreen.

item.description: In summertime we marine biologist get to venture out in the sun. Despite regular winds most of the year, summers here are great. But at these high latitudes they are short, only about 3 months. Unfortunately for me, I can get sea sick but still I manage to work my way around it. Figure 1: Click the slideshow above, press 'c' to clone it (opens on a seperate window) and then press 'f' for fullscreen.

item.title: About me
item.description: We are a family of five and live in a little village, in the north of Iceland, called Skagastr√∂nd. We came here for a job and have stayed a bit longer than we expected (since the spring of 2015). Our kids have become proud villagers and one of them is born here, he was born in 2016 but his older sisters were born 2008 and 2010. I did not take the traditional route in my education, I made some shorter stops here and there on the job market and had a good time drumming and playing basketball in my early twenties, those skills have proved important later on socially.

item.title: Talks and reports
item.description: Reports H√©r eru nokkur erindi og sk√Ωrslur ger√∞ar √≠ R me√∞ Bookdown: Name Link Language √ñrplast √≠ hafinu vi√∞ √çsland üîó [üáÆüá∏] √ûarabrei√∞ur √≠ H√∫nafl√≥a üîó [üáÆüá∏] Microplastic lab protocol üîó Eng Erindi - Sources and Pathways of Microplastics to Icelandic Seas International Symposium on Plastics in the Arctic March 2020. This is a talk from a report made for the Environmental Ministry of Iceland.
